Although ammonia is a listed toxic substance, it is also a ubiquitous material, which is used by the surrounding farmers for fertilizer. Pursuant to 40 CFR 68.125 Exemptions ¿ Ammonia used as an agricultural nutrient, when held by farmers, is exempt from all provisions of this part (40 CFR 68).

III.	Facility Identification
The Nation Pizza Products facility is located at 601 East Algonquin Road in Schaumburg, Illinois.  The facility is a producer of custom and branded pizza and dough related products for food marketers and manufacturers, food service industry, and retailers in the United States. 

The NAICS code for the facility is 311412. Many areas of the plant are refrigerated to preserve ingredients, pizza, and dough products.   

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There are two (2) refrigeration systems onsite that are used for refrigerating pizza products. 

The amount of ammonia currently present in the refrigeration system #1 is approximately 13,000 pounds.  Refrigeration system #1 is used to cool production rooms, holding freezers, and a frigo blast freezer.  This system is a two-stage system with four (4) high stage compressors and two (2) booster compressors.  Evaporators in the production areas are fed with high pressure pumped liquid from the receiver, the holding freezer evaporators are fed from the intercooler at 32 psi, and the frigo blast freezer is feed pumped liquid at 30 psi from another intercooler.                                                    

The amount of ammonia currently present in the refrigeration system #2 is approximat

ely 32,000 pounds.  Refrigeration system # 2 is used to cool production rooms, spiral freezers, a cheese freezer, a holding cooler, and a plate and frame glycol chiller.  This system is a two-stage system with three (3) high stage compressors and two (2) booster compressors.  Evaporators in the production areas are three (3) to one (1) liquid overfeed pumped liquid from the intercooler, and the spiral freezers are feed pumped liquid from the recirculator tank.

The total amount of ammonia onsite, considering the quantities in system #1 and #2, is approximately 45,000 pounds, which is above the minimum threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds.

VI.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program
A prevention program is in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases in accordance with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Program.   However, as discussed through out this document Nation Pizza Products is actively working on improving this program. 

This prevention program covers those processes that handle ammonia above the threshold quantity for both PSM and RMP rules. The next audit of the PSM program will occur by December 05, 2005, in compliance with the requirement to conduct PSM audits every three years.  The elements of the PSM / Program 3

prevention program and a brief description are listed below.
·	Employee Participation ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees and their representatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program will ensure employees and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.  
·	Process Safety Information ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained. Process safety information for the ammonia process has been compiled and was last reviewed and updated as of December 05, 2002.
·	Process Hazard Review ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific PHA program that ensures a PHA is conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI.  In addition, this program will ensure PHAs are conducted in accordance with OSHA and EPA regulations and ensure findings and recommendations of PHAs are properly documented. Nation Pizza Products plans to conduct a thorough PHA study for refrigeration system #1 and #2 during July 2003.
·	Operating Procedures ¿ Nation Pizza Product is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific procedure that ensures operating procedures provide clear instruction for different phases of process operations and ensures they are properly maintained.  Nation Pizza Products plans to develop/update operating procedures for both system #1 and #2 during August 2003.  Annually, the operating procedures will be reviewed and certified as accurate.
·	Training ¿

Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific training procedure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the potential hazards of the process, and understand the causes of process problems.
·	Management of Change ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. 
·	Pre-Startup Review ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.
·	Mechanical Integrity ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.  Nation Pizza Products plans to formalize maintenance procedures for refrigeration system #1 and #2 during August 2003.
·	Contractor Qualifications ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific contractor qualification procedure that ensures all contract employers¿ safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between Nation Pizza Products and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, such as the provisions of the emergency action plan and control over entrance into process areas.
·	Incident Investigation ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing

/updating a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 
·	Compliance Audit ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Nation Pizza Products PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed.  A compliance audit was conducted on December 5, 2002, and the next compliance audit will be conducted by December 5, 2005.  
·	Hot Work Permits ¿ Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a best management practice for hot work.

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The Nation Pizza Products facility has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years.

VIII.	Emergency Response Program
Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating Emergency Response/Action Plan (ERAP), to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 

Although a formal written ERAP plan is in the process of being developed/updated, Nation Pizza Products has communicated and trained facility employees on proper evacuation procedures and has had interaction (i.e. onsite inspections) with the Schaumburg Fire Department. 

In the near future, Nation Pizza Products plans to coordinate their ERAP with the Cook C

ounty North Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the Schaumburg Fire Department.  This coordination effort will include, providing each aforementioned agency with a copy of our ERAP, providing each with a site diagram and hazardous material information, meeting with Schaumburg Fire Department personnel to discuss the facilities operations/processes, and encouraging periodic on-site inspections and coordination with Schaumburg Fire Department personnel.

Nation Pizza Products is currently evaluating their current hazardous materials response team and evaluating if their employees will be responsible for investigating and assisting the Schaumburg Fire Department (if necessary) with response to accidental releases of ammonia. 

Several employees on staff have received HAZWOPER training through classroom instruction, on-the-job training and drills. The current HAZWOPER training includes the first responder awareness level, the first responder operations level and hazardous materials technician training.   

The facility has four (4) windsocks (one at each corner of the building) present onsite for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release. 

The current Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix F. 

IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite in case of an emergency.  

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of Nation Pizza Products operations. Nation Pizza Products recently conducted an audit of their Process Safety Management Program and will be dutifully implementing the recommendations from that audit. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Nation Pizza Products. In addition to developing/updating the facility ERP, the plant will be making arrangements to be included in the community emergency response plan developed by the Cook County

North LEPC. 

XI.	Management Program
Nation Pizza Products is in the process of developing/updating a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system will assign qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals will be documented and the lines of authority defined through an organization chart or similar document.  Currently, Michael Alagna, Chief Operations Officer, is responsible for implementation of the overall Risk Management Program.
